issues.description: In the template repository, the Meal constructor is defined with parameters in the order (String[] ingredients, String name), but in Main.java, it is instantiated with parameters in the order (String name, String[] ingredients), leading to a compilation error. This inconsistency within the template repository would confuse students as the provided code does not compile, preventing them from testing and understanding the starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the Meal constructor in the template repository to match the order used in Main.java, such as changing it to public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients), to ensure the template code compiles and aligns with the solution repository, while preserving the educational intent of having students work with the class.

issues.description: The Meal constructor in the template repository has its parameters in a different order compared to the problem statement and solution repository, potentially confusing students about how to correctly instantiate the Meal class and leading to compilation errors when following the problem's description.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the Meal constructor in the template repository to match the order in the problem statement and solution repository, changing it to public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) to ensure consistent parameter mapping and reduce student confusion.
